column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=custom.Span|label
#T_RL=custom.Relation|label|BT_custom.Span
#Text=The Musk Rat.
#Text=In the Memoirs of the French Academy of Sciences
#Text=for the year 1725, there is a complete description of
#Text=piece of cookery , from Holland.
#Text=It comes to England in leaden pots, sewed up in
#Text=canvas : this is of a very deep brick colour,
#Text=and is assuredly nothing else than blood
#Text=dried and mixed up with oil and spirit
#Text=(tincture) of true musk.
#Text=This sort is frequently sold to the perfumers by pretended
#Text=sailors, at so low a price as two or three
#Text=shillings per ounce ; whereas, one ounce
#Text=of true China musk, at sixteen shillings, is
#Text=by far the cheapest, for this quantity of the
#Text=true musk is as much as may be supposed
#Text=to enter into the composition of a whole
#Text=pound of the other.
#Text=The true China musk
#Text=is of the colour of an old brown nutmeg : it
#Text=is generally rolled up, or contained in the
#Text=pod, in the form of little round pills, and
#Text=has a very strong, fine, and agreeable,
#Text=though singular, smell.
#Text=The musk imported from China (which,
#Text=if possessed of the above characters, is by
#Text=far the best) is contained in caddies, or
#Text=cabinets, in quantities of from 20 to 50 and
#Text=100 ounces, each.
#Text=Some, likewise, is
#Text=imported from Bengal.
#Text=The true Russian musk, in pod, mentioned above, is more loose, and has none
#Text=
#Text=
#Text=of the round balls or pills, like that from
#Text=China.
#Text=It has also, with its own proper
#Text=perfume, a very distinguishing smell of
#Text=urine.
#Text=As for the other Russian, or rather Dutch
#Text=musk, in pots ; it is generally very moist
#Text=and exhales a most disagreeable and predominant ammoniacal smell, whenever the
#Text=pots are opened.
#Text=This sort is of so little
#Text=value, that any thing need hardly be said
#Text=about it, further, than that it should never
#Text=be used at all.
#Text=The Musk Bags , or Pods.
#Text=When the musk is taken out of the pod,
#Text=the pod may be cut in very small pieces, or
#Text=grated very fine by means of a tin grater.
#Text=This powder will be of great use in several
#Text=perfumery compositions, as will be afterwards directed ; for it has the odour of the
#Text=finest parts of the musk, without that of the
#Text=disagreeable ingredients which may happen to be present.
